definition: to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

sentences.english: An administrative abstrusearial position wactuality advice abilities and a affable attitude against humans will be assets.
sentences.chinese: 行政秘书的职务，用得上交际技能和与人为善的立场。

sentences.english: I can teach you about kindness, but I cannot force you to be gracious.
sentences.chinese: 我能教你与人为善，但不能强迫你宽以待人。

sentences.english: Finally I told myself to helping others, smile.
sentences.chinese: 最后我告诉自己要与人为善，要笑对人生。

sentences.english: "It wasn't just a family feeling or being nice to each other," he says.
sentences.chinese: 这不只是家人的感觉或者与人为善。

sentences.english: Criticism should be aimed at helping those criticized.
sentences.chinese: 批评应该是与人为善的批评。

sentences.english: Rejoice in your friends, avoid the law and controversies.
sentences.chinese: 与人为善，与友同乐，莫触犯法律，涉及争论。

sentences.english: The new testament is a good code of ethics.
sentences.chinese: “新约”则贩卖与人为善的道德准则。

sentences.english: "Tolerate to others, discipline myself" was also a teaching from him.
sentences.chinese: “与人为善，严于律己”是祖父教导的家训。

sentences.english: I hope you forgive me for what happened, as I had just started to learn about human behavior. Since then, I have learned that people should appear kind to others in public.
sentences.chinese: 后来我懂得了人应该在公共场合与人为善。

sentences.english: Appreciate , be kind, be gentle. Laugh a little more.
sentences.chinese: 学会感激，与人为善，礼貌待人，笑多一点。

sentences.english: Appreciate, be kind, be gentle. Laugh a little more.
sentences.chinese: 学会感激，与人为善，礼貌待人，笑多点。

definition: to conduct oneself/to behave with integrity
respect the old and cherish the young
to return good for evil (idiom)/to requite evil with good
